situation: SolidJS <For> with derived arrays that recompute every tick (e.g. facts() depending on 1s timer signal) destroys/recreates DOM elements each render, resetting CSS animations mid-flip. Didn't catch this during implementation because smoke test only checked content rendering, not animation behavior.
learning: When using SolidJS <For> with arrays derived from reactive signals that update frequently, use <Index> instead (position-stable) or ensure array references are stable. Always consider animation/transition behavior when reactive data drives list rendering — content correctness alone isn't sufficient verification.

situation: Param controls were hidden behind a small gear icon on each FlipCard's settings face. User couldn't find them. The params belonged to the Section, not individual cards, but were duplicated on every card.
learning: Controls that users need to discover should be visible at the level they belong to. Don't hide section-level controls inside individual card interactions — show them at the section level with a clear toggle.

situation: Added cross-section param sharing to the deferred backlog. Sam pushed back: don't add speculative features to any list until there's an actual need. Wait for the real birthday card implementation to surface real requirements.
learning: Don't add speculative features to backlogs. Only track work items that have demonstrated need. Building the real product will surface real requirements — speculating ahead of that wastes planning energy.
